results.title: Amelia Rose Towers
results.creator_credit: Nicole Sorby, AFTRS and Jackie Farkas
results.brief_description: This multi-award winning Australian short film is distinctly theatrical with its background of rap and parade of surrealist images. The atmosphere is acute and claustrophobic, full of anxiety, fear and loathing. Amelia Rose Towers, whose initials spell ART, faces an adversary who spells MAN, and offers us fragmented glimpses of her own fragile identity.

results.title: Amelia Rose Towers
results.creator_credit: Nicole Sorby, AFTRS, Jackie Farkas and Ashley Scarlett
results.brief_description: If, as a child, you were picked last for a team. And sought as your refuge a wish or a dream. If you ever felt lonely, peculiar or blue, then Amelia Rose Towers is a bit like you! True! Amelia Rose Towers ‘ whose initials spell ART ‘ faces off against an adversary whose initials spell MAN, after passing through surrealist chambers and screens offering images of a personal identity that can never be reconciled. A story of juggling variables of reality of self and other ; of space, time and perceptions; of the art of science and the science of art but it is also a story of hope, love and courage.

results.title: Ambassadors discuss the decade for women
results.creator_credit: Judith Dahlitz and Centre for Social Development and Humanitarian Affairs (United Nations)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Women’s Decade”.
Four heads of permanent missions to the United Nations discuss the issues of women’s rights. 1976-1985 has been designated as the United Nations decade for women, and a female journalist interviews these four male ambassadors about aims for this decade.

results.title: Amazing ants
results.brief_description: Explores life in an ant colony. Shows ants fending for and protecting themselves and milking a herd of aphids. Also reveals the intricate tunnels of an underground nest, food storage and the care of young larvae and pupae.

results.title: Amateur boxing: how to conduct a bout
results.creator_credit: Frank Wells, J. Arthur Rank Organisation and Colin Bell
results.brief_description: This film is directed to teachers and instructors rather than boy boxers. It shows a three-round bout between two boys considering the match from the viewpoint of the officials. Demonstrates the work of the referee, the timekeeper and in greater detail, methods used by the referee for controlling the bout, and the methods of the judges for assessing the merits of the boxers. Shows, also, the value of a boxer’s seconds. Demonstrates how boxing can encourage sportsmanship.

results.title: Alzheimer's disease and other dementias: Diagnosis = Speaking from experience
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speaking from experience”.
This Australian program presents a sensitive account of Alzheimer’s disease from the point of view of their families and carers. It looks at the early signs and behaviours, and the ways in which the patients and their carers handle diagnosis of the condition. The emotional impact this disease has on families is openly discussed, as well as practical advice given on how carers can best handle the progression of the condition.

results.title: Aluminium in the 80's: the Comalco story
results.creator_credit: Terence McMahon, Comalco and Terence McMahon Productions
results.brief_description: Gives an up-to-date account of the changing forces and the topical issues confronting Australia’s aluminium industry. It considers such topics as the economic benefits Australia will derive from an expanded aluminium industry; why power prices for smelters must be kept low; the extent to which Australia’s enormous coal resources will be devoted to this industry; why smelting is becoming more important than the export of raw bauxite; and the overall competitiveness of Australia’s aluminium industry. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
